data.title: From Blender to collada to urho scene importing. Light will always point the wrong way.
data.body:
I noticed that when I used the path of going from blender to collada, and then from collada to urho3d, the light seems to point exactly the opposite direction. The Light always has same weird rotation. For me this value would be:
<attribute name="Rotation" value="-4.37114e-008 0 -1 0" />

If I set this value to 1 0 0 0, then the light points in the correct way, since the light is attached to a node.

data.title: external Urho3D project no longer finding right libraries/include folders
data.body:
Hi there,

I'm running Linux (Ubuntu 14.04), and I recently made a standalone version of Example 34:  https://github.com/lowagner/urho3d-standalone
This worked with the old Urho3D (1.32) version, but now I am having issues with the latest Urho3D from github.  Here is the problem trying to compile my standalone version:

```
~/code/urho3d-standalone/build$ export URHO3D_HOME=/home/lowagner/code/Urho3D/Build && cmake ../Source
-- The C compiler identification is GNU 4.8.2
-- The CXX compiler identification is GNU 4.8.2
-- Check for working C compiler: /usr/bin/cc
-- Check for working C compiler: /usr/bin/cc -- works
-- Detecting C compiler ABI info
-- Detecting C compiler ABI info - done
-- Check for working CXX compiler: /usr/bin/c++
-- Check for working CXX compiler: /usr/bin/c++ -- works
-- Detecting CXX compiler ABI info
-- Detecting CXX compiler ABI info - done
-- Found Urho3D: /home/lowagner/code/Urho3D/Build/lib/libUrho3D.a
-- Configuring done
-- Generating done
-- Build files have been written to: /home/lowagner/code/urho3d-standalone/build
~/code/urho3d-standalone/build$ make
Scanning dependencies of target 34_DynamicGeometry
[100%] Building CXX object CMakeFiles/34_DynamicGeometry.dir/DynamicGeometry.cpp.o
/home/lowagner/code/urho3d-standalone/DynamicGeometry.cpp:23:20: fatal error: Camera.h: No such file or directory
 #include "Camera.h"
```

Even though Camera.h is clearly both here:
/usr/local/include/Urho3D/Graphics/Camera.h
and here
/home/lowagner/code/Urho3D/Build/include/Urho3D/Graphics/Camera.h

I've setup my Urho3D via:

```
mkdir Build
cd Build
cmake ..
make
sudo make install
```

Some of the changes to FindUrho3D causing the problem, or the new way Urho3D organizes itself?

Thanks in advance.

data.title: Client and Server in the same process
data.body:
Hey there!
I've been looking at this engine, and it looks very impressive!
However, I've stumbled upon a use-case for which there does not seem to be any support.
According to the examples and the manual, multiplayer can only be done using two different processes; While in many games, the client and server can be separate threads in the same process.

I've tried to replicate this in urho, by creating two contexts and Client and Server Applications, and running the server first in an std::async, followed by the client being ->Run() normally, as no window would open with the client also in an async. It compiles, and even runs without crashing. But it is extremely slow, and the console is flooded with "Sending events is only supported from the main thread". It is clear that the server is causing interference somehow.
Having it be possible to run the client and the server in one process would certainly be a great addition to the engine, and I am willing to work on that, but first I wanted to ask you guys if you have done any research on this, if you have any tips, or if you can say for certain that this task is simply not suited to the architecture of the engine?

data.body: When many objects in the scene is very uncomfortable to find for them in the list. I thing we need possibility to selection objects by mouse click in scene.

data.title: [Editor] String attributes not correct when default value is used
data.body:
To illustrate my issue, assume there's an attribute like: 

ATTRIBUTE("Team", String,  _attr_unitTeam, "ALLY", AM_DEFAULT);

With this set up, typing "ALLY" in the editor to the attribute field, makes it not get saved in the XML (that's intended behaviour AFAIK, to save space), but then when actually parsing that attribute on ApplyAttributes, the value of _attr_unitTeam is not correct and is a blank String instead.

I assume is an issue with the editor.

data.title: URHO3D_API issue caused project build to fail
data.body:
Attempting to a build a project that worked earlier with the newest Urho3D version from source gives me the following error:

```
/.../Urho3D/include/Urho3D/Engine/../Core/../Core/../Container/../Container/RefCounted.h:53:18: error: variable 'Urho3D::URHO3D_API Urho3D::RefCounted' has initializer but incomplete type
 class URHO3D_API RefCounted

/.../Urho3D/include/Urho3D/Engine/../Core/../Core/../Container/../Container/RefCounted.h:53:18: warning: extended initializer lists only available with -std=c++11 or -std=gnu++11 [enabled by default]
/home/nick/Apps/Urho3D/include/Urho3D/Engine/../Core/../Core/../Container/../Container/RefCounted.h:55:1: error: expected primary-expression before 'public'
 public:
 ^
/.../Urho3D/include/Urho3D/Engine/../Core/../Core/../Container/../Container/RefCounted.h:55:1: error: expected '}' before 'public'
/.../Urho3D/include/Urho3D/Engine/../Core/../Core/../Container/../Container/RefCounted.h:55:1: error: expected ',' or ';' before 'public'
/.../Urho3D/include/Urho3D/Engine/../Core/../Core/../Container/../Container/RefCounted.h:59:24: error: expected class-name before '(' token
     virtual ~RefCounted();
```

Followed by a host of issues that lead me to believe that the URHO3D_API declaration isn't being resolved correctly, thereby causing the declaration of RefCounted as a class to be botched.

I'm running Ubuntu 14.04 64-bit, using CMake as a build system with the latest Urho3D built-from-source version.

data.title: IsNaN and GCC
URHO3D_SAFE_LUA=ON build fails on Linux x64, GCC 4.9.2
data.body:
Errors appear in a tolua++-generated file:

```
[ 51%] Building CXX object Source/Urho3D/CMakeFiles/Urho3D.dir/generated/LuaScriptLuaAPI.cpp.o
/home/me/work/urho3d/Build/linux64-debug/Source/Urho3D/generated/LuaScriptLuaAPI.cpp: In function int tolua_LuaScriptLuaAPI_LuaScriptInstance_SubscribeToEvent(lua_State*):
/home/me/work/urho3d/Build/linux64-debug/Source/Urho3D/generated/LuaScriptLuaAPI.cpp:251:1: warning: jump to label tolua_lerror [-fpermissive]
 tolua_lerror:
 ^
/home/me/work/urho3d/Build/linux64-debug/Source/Urho3D/generated/LuaScriptLuaAPI.cpp:205:18: warning:   from here [-fpermissive]
             goto tolua_lerror;
                  ^
/home/me/work/urho3d/Build/linux64-debug/Source/Urho3D/generated/LuaScriptLuaAPI.cpp:220:24: error:   crosses initialization of Urho3D::LuaScriptInstance* self
     LuaScriptInstance* self = (LuaScriptInstance*)  tolua_tousertype(tolua_S,1,0);
                        ^
```

At first I assumed it's because of new GCC version, but then I found [an old thread at StackOverflow](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/14274225/statement-goto-can-not-cross-pointer-definition) about the same error. So I suppose this is related to recent build system changes. tolua++ is guilty of course, but I doubt it's still maintained ([it's homepage is 404 now](http://www.codenix.com/~tolua/)), and fixing it may be hard.

data.title: Ninja build (cmake -GNinja) doesn't work since recent PCH changes
data.body:
Everything is OK, when I use Make for building, but when I use Ninja, I have an error, which is repeated for multiple AssImp files:

```
[446/842] Building CXX object Source/ThirdParty/Assimp/CMakeFiles/Assimp.dir/code/ImporterRegistry.cpp.o
FAILED: /usr/bin/c++   -DASSIMP_BUILD_BOOST_WORKAROUND -DGLEW_NO_GLU -DGLEW_STATIC -DHAVE_STDINT_H -DKNET_UNIX -DURHO3D_ANGELSCRIPT -DURHO3D_FILEWATCHER -DURHO3D_LOGGING -DURHO3D_NAVIGATION -DURHO3D_NETWORK -DURHO3D_OPENGL -DURHO3D_PHYSICS -DURHO3D_PROFILING -DURHO3D_SSE -DURHO3D_STATIC_DEFINE -DURHO3D_URHO2D -Wno-invalid-offsetof -ffast-math -m64 -O3 -DNDEBUG -Iinclude -Iinclude/Urho3D/ThirdParty -Iinclude/Urho3D/ThirdParty/Bullet -I../../Source/ThirdParty/Assimp/include -I../../Source/ThirdParty/Assimp/code/BoostWorkaround -I../../Source/ThirdParty/Assimp/contrib/unzip    -include AssimpPCH.h -MMD -MT Source/ThirdParty/Assimp/CMakeFiles/Assimp.dir/code/ImporterRegistry.cpp.o -MF Source/ThirdParty/Assimp/CMakeFiles/Assimp.dir/code/ImporterRegistry.cpp.o.d -o Source/ThirdParty/Assimp/CMakeFiles/Assimp.dir/code/ImporterRegistry.cpp.o -c ../../Source/ThirdParty/Assimp/code/ImporterRegistry.cpp
In file included from <command-line>:0:0:
/usr/include/stdc-predef.h:59:1: fatal error: AssimpPCH.h: No such file or directory
 #endif
 ^
compilation terminated.
```

There are build instructions, which CMake generates for this file in `build.ninja`:

```
build Source/ThirdParty/Assimp/CMakeFiles/Assimp.dir/code/ImporterRegistry.cpp.o: CXX_COMPILER ../../Source/ThirdParty/Assimp/code/ImporterRegistry.cpp || cmake_order_depends_target_Assimp
  DEFINES = -DASSIMP_BUILD_BOOST_WORKAROUND -DGLEW_NO_GLU -DGLEW_STATIC -DHAVE_STDINT_H -DKNET_UNIX -DURHO3D_ANGELSCRIPT -DURHO3D_FILEWATCHER -DURHO3D_LOGGING -DURHO3D_NAVIGATION -DURHO3D_NETWORK -DURHO3D_OPENGL -DURHO3D_PHYSICS -DURHO3D_PROFILING -DURHO3D_SSE -DURHO3D_STATIC_DEFINE -DURHO3D_URHO2D
  DEP_FILE = Source/ThirdParty/Assimp/CMakeFiles/Assimp.dir/code/ImporterRegistry.cpp.o.d
  FLAGS = -Wno-invalid-offsetof -ffast-math -m64 -O3 -DNDEBUG -Iinclude -Iinclude/Urho3D/ThirdParty -Iinclude/Urho3D/ThirdParty/Bullet -I../../Source/ThirdParty/Assimp/include -I../../Source/ThirdParty/Assimp/code/BoostWorkaround -I../../Source/ThirdParty/Assimp/contrib/unzip    -include AssimpPCH.h
  OBJECT_DIR = Source/ThirdParty/Assimp/CMakeFiles/Assimp.dir
  OBJECT_FILE_DIR = Source/ThirdParty/Assimp/CMakeFiles/Assimp.dir/code
  TARGET_COMPILE_PDB = Source/ThirdParty/Assimp/CMakeFiles/Assimp.dir/
  TARGET_PDB = bin/tool/libAssimp.pdb
```

`../../` here is path to Urho's source root. `AssimpPCH.h` is actually located at `../../Source/ThirdParty/Assimp/code/AssimpPCH.h`, and there is no copy or symlink of it inside the build tree if it's expected.

data.title: Events2D and documentation
data.body:
ScriptAPIDump.cpp scans for "Events.h" pattern to generate the 'Event List', so currently "Events2D.h" is skipped.
This can be fixed for example by including "Events2D.h" in the search pattern, or by renaming "Events2D" files to "2DEvents" (currently only PhysicsEvents2D.h is concerned).

Also, in PhysicsEvents2D.h, C++ and script event names are not "in sync" for pre-step event (we have E_PHYSICSPRESTEP2D and Physics2DPreStep2D), maybe we should rename "Physics2DPreStep2D" to "PhysicsPreStep2D".

data.title: Travis-CI: The dreaded process being killed during CI build
data.body:
It is a known problem (See #430 and #536) that Travis-CI has a serious memory problem in their worker VM snapshots. Some worker snapshots come with a reduced memory to begin with even before CI build starts and some how the memory kept leaking while CI build is in progress. When the free memory is almost completely used up, to the point that the swap partition cannot help then process would get killed.

We have provided our analysis on this problem to upstream but so far there is still no resolution from upstream. We have also enhanced our CI build to be as memory efficient as possible, even with "build rule" to automatically switch build configuration and/or skip processes in the CI build (e.g. make test) when detected a "bad" VM snapshot being used.

However, despite our best effort to mitigate this problem, we have only delayed the inevitable from happening sooner, i.e. not  while our CI build still in progress. With more and more samples being included into our repository, the situation is becoming more difficult and we start to see the process being killed problem back again toward the end of our CI builds lately. Mostly while attempting to upload the build artifacts or to update the main website. Since those are not considered critical processes in our CI build, the overall build status remains green. But sooner or later the process getting killed will be from one of our critical processes when Urho3D code base keeps growing.

Proposed solution:
- Evaluate to switch to other CI solutions, like Jenkins.
- Stay on Travis CI but evaluate to switch to use Docker (http://blog.travis-ci.com/2014-12-17-faster-builds-with-container-based-infrastructure/). The only caveat is, the Docker-container build infrastructure does not allow to use "sudo" command and currently our CI builds use this command in a few places.

We should all keep an eye on the number of samples in the project until the problem is fully resolved. Combining a few easier or related samples into one, if have to. Thanks for reading this.

data.title: Lua: Objects not being garbage collected.
data.body:
I believe there may be a problem with the way Lua and tolua collect garbage from locally created objects and objects that are returned as values from C++ calls.

I have pasted here a small example: http://pastebin.com/bd8f1M6G]. The sample uses the Lua sample framework and sets up a very simple scene. It displays the currently used memory as reported by collectgarbage("count"). If you execute the script, you are given the option to press 'd' to run the function:

[code]
function DoThing()
    local c
    for c=1,10000000,1 do
        local c=Color(1,1,1,1)
    end
end
[/code]

All it does is loop a large number of times and create a local Color object. (It's not just Color objects that exhibit the problem; pretty much any object type will do.) The loop will execute, then the update function will update the on-screen text with the amount of memory currently being used. Update also includes an explicit call to collectgarbage() to execute a full collection cycle.

Here is a screenshot from before 'd' is pressed: http://i.imgur.com/nMaE6fZ.png

Here is a screenshot from after: http://i.imgur.com/xxNeZm0.png

As you can see, even with the collectgarbage() call, there is still a LOT of memory used, memory that should be freed up by a garbage collection cycle because it was all allocated as temporary locals inside the DoThing loop. Note also the drastic framerate drop. This drop is permanent, as is the memory hogging. Leaving the window to run for several minutes results in zero change.

I noticed this behavior with a game project that I have since semi-abandoned due to performance issues. As time went by the framerate would drop to unworkable levels. Revisiting the project and logging reported memory use showed that garbage was accruing and never being cleaned up, resulting in a progressive performance loss.

Edit: The behavior occurs in builds using both Lua and LuaJIT.

data.title: Networking breaks on non-windows non-debug mode
data.body:
The network demo breaks within a few seconds for me. Always works on windows, and never works for me on other systems when not compiled in debug mode. Debug mode fixes the issue. I've tried both on localhost server/client configuration and actual two computers configuration.

Observed on:

Linux
version: Sabayon (gentoo-based, vanilla install)
compiler: g++ (Gentoo Hardened 4.8.3 p1.1, pie-0.5.9) 4.8.3
kernel: 3.17.0-sabayon
processor: x86_64 AMD Phenom(tm) II X4 920 Processor

Mac OSX
version: 10.9.5
compiler: Apple LLVM version 6.0 (clang-600.0.56) (based on LLVM 3.5svn)
kernel: 13.4.0
processor: Intel core i7 x86_64

I would attach log outputs, but they're different every time where and how it breaks, which makes me think is a memory issue, or a variant of that such as a threading issue. I seem to be the only one in the forums who can replicate this issue so please ping me if you have any hints how I can debug this.

Form post: http://urho3d.prophpbb.com/topic652.html

data.title: UnsubscribeFromEvent() inoperant in lua
data.body:
Unsubscribing from events in lua no longer works.

Simple lua script to replicate:

``` lua
function Start()
    CreateButton()
    input.mouseVisible = true
end

function CreateButton()
    button = ui.root:CreateChild("Button")
    button:SetSize(200, 100)
    button:SetAlignment(HA_CENTER, VA_CENTER)
    SubscribeToEvent(button, "HoverBegin", "HandleHoverBegin")
    SubscribeToEvent(button, "Released", "HandleClicked")
end

function HandleHoverBegin(eventType, eventData)
    UnsubscribeFromEvent("HoverBegin")
    UnsubscribeFromEvent("HoverBegin", "HandleHoverBegin")
    print("Hover")
end

function HandleClicked(eventType, eventData)
    UnsubscribeFromEvent("Released")
    UnsubscribeFromEvent("Released", "HandleClicked")
    print("Click")
end
```

Whatever method is used to unsubscribe, button continues to send "HoverBegin" and "Released" events.
This issue is lua specific, it works fine in AngelScript.

data.title: Segfault when using ui::Clear() with engine::RunFrame()
data.body:
Simple lua script to replicate:

``` lua
function Start()
    CreateButton()
    input.mouseVisible = true
end

function CreateButton()
    local button = ui.root:CreateChild("Button")
    button:SetSize(200, 100)
    button:SetAlignment(HA_CENTER, VA_CENTER)
    SubscribeToEvent(button, "Released", "Reload")
end

function Reload(eventType, eventData)
    UnsubscribeFromAllEvents()
    ui:Clear()
    engine:RunFrame()
    CreateButton()
end
```

Note that:
- it may take more than one single click on the button to reproduce the crash (3 clicks should be enough)
- this piece of code worked fine a few months ago.

data.title: Added 2 Urho2D samples (isometric demo and platformer)
